campaigns.cancelling.title: You're about to cancel a campaign
campaigns.cancelling.warning:
This campaign will not be executed on any further devices,
and will be moved to Finished.
campaigns.details.cancel_tooltip: When you cancel a campaign, any update operations that are pending or already in progress will still complete. The campaign is canceled only for devices that haven't yet detected the new update.

campaigns.retry.description_1: • OTA Connect retries installation on each devices once only.
• After this retry cycle is completed, you'll see fresh failure statistics for all installation attempts in this retry cycle.
• You cannot start a retry cycle for another error type before this retry cycle is finished.
• If a device is installing another update, this retry cycle will not apply to the device.
campaigns.retry.description_2: • You'll need to diagnose what's going wrong and possibly update your software.
• You can export the list of devices with failed installations to help with your analysis.
• Once you've figured it out, create another update and deploy it in another campaign.
campaigns.retry.header_1: For this campaign, retry all installations that failed due to the following error:

Title is already taken. Take a different one.
devices.custom-fields.rename-modal.title: Custom device fields
devices.custom-fields.title: CUSTOM DEVICE FIELDS
devices.custom-fields.uploading.descript: You can upload a .csv file with a list of device IDs in one column and the corresponding field in the next column to the right. Make sure the device IDs are already provisioned. If a device ID is included in the file, its custom fields are fully overwritten. When the file is uploaded to this environment, you can create smart groups based on your 20 custom device fields.
devices.custom-fields.uploading.title: Upload custom device fields
devices.custom-fields.uploading.uploadin: An error occurred. Please try again.
The file format is not correct. Please adjust it and try again.
The custom device fields were uploaded
devices.dashboard.title: Dashboard
devices.delete_confirmation:
Remove {{device_name}} permanently?


When you delete a device, it is removed from the user interface and the update history is deleted, but you can still provision it again.


If the device is a part of any active campaigns, any devices that haven't installed it yet will fail the campaign.


This action cannot be undone.
devices.empty-group-fixed-1: No devices added to this fixed group
devices.empty-group-smart-1: No devices that match this smart group
devices.empty-group-smart-2: Provision matching devices, and they will show up here.
devices.empty.no-devices-2: Provision devices, and they will show up here.
devices.empty.technical-issues: We are experiencing some technical issues while getting devices data. Please try again soon.
devices.hardware.no_hardware_reported: This device hasn’t reported any information about its hardware or system components yet.
devices.hardware.secondary_ecus_descript: In many connected mobility domains, most notably in automotive, it is common to have a device,
vehicle, or platform that has multiple independent micro-controllers or other devices networked together.
HERE OTA Connect is built to handle updates to those other micro-controllers even if they don't have an
internet connection, or are too resource-constrained to run a full updater client themselves.
The device that has a direct internet connection – the one running the HERE OTA Connect client
– is called the "Primary control unit", and is able to distribute firmware updates to
If you don't have multiple devices to update from one primary/master device,
you don't need to worry about this functionality.
devices.hardware.title: Hardware
devices.mtu.approval_pending.cancel_tool: You can cancel an update as long as the device has not detected it yet. After the device has detected an update, you can no longer cancel it.
devices.mtu.approval_pending.description: The device won't receive new updates until the end user has provided their consent. Wait until this update has finished before you launch another campaign. In case multiple updates have pending consent, only one update will be given consent to progress.
devices.mtu.approval_pending.estimated_t: Estimated time to install this update :

devices.mtu.approvalpending.no-updates: No campaigns waiting for consent on this device.

devices.mtu.properties.install_tooltip: If a device has multiple control units with the same type, all of these control units will get the update.
devices.mtu.properties.installed_outside: This software was installed outside of OTA Connect so there are no details to display.

devices.mtu.properties.select_package_de: Select the package version to see its details.
devices.mtu.queue.description: Devices can't receive new updates when an update is still in progress. Wait until this update has finished before you launch another campaign. The device might need to be rebooted to be finished.
devices.mtu.queue.no-updates: No updates being installed on this device
devices.software.auto_update_info: Automatic update activated. The latest version of this package will automatically be installed on this device.
devices.software.automatic_update_toolti: Automatic updates only get created when a new image is pushed while auto-updates are turned on; turning on auto-updates for a device will not trigger updates for any images that were already in the repository at the time auto-updating was activated.

devices.statistics.tooltip_failed: Devices where at least one update that failed to install for various reasons. For more details, see the reported failure codes.
devices.statistics.tooltip_installing: Devices that are still installing one or more updates from this campaign.
devices.statistics.tooltip_not_applicabl: Devices where none of the control units or software versions match the targeting criteria of the update. Can also indicate devices that are busy installing updates from another campaign, or devices where the update has been cancelled.
devices.statistics.tooltip_success: Devices that have successfully installed their updates.

groups.creating.smart-group.description-: You can filter for devices based on the device ID or your

The device ID is defined in the OTA Connect client configuration. If no ID is configured for the device, OTA Connect automatically generates one for you. However, this feature works best when you preconfigure your own IDs, such as device serial numbers. For more information on how to configure the device ID, see the

profile.organization.create-modal.input-: Names can contain only letters, numbers, spaces and these characters: ' \ " , ; : . - _ / ( )
Names have to be 30 characters or fewer.
profile.organization.create-modal.subtit: You can create up to 10 environments
profile.organization.creator: Creator
profile.organization.creator-tooltip: The person who set up this environment. They can leave or be removed from it.
profile.organization.header.home-env-too: This is the environment you get when you register. You can't leave it or be removed from it.
profile.organization.list.headers.name: NAME
profile.organization.max-env-modal.desc: You can't create another environment because you have reached the limit of 10.
profile.organization.max-env-modal.title: Too many environments
profile.organization.members-description: People you add here must have an OTA Connect account. If you are unsure check with that person first. People in this list can collaborate on campaigns with other members in the environment. Please, remember that the device details may contain personal information and will be visible to all added members collaborating in your environment. Ensure that they have the legal right to access this information.
profile.organization.name: Environment Name
profile.organization.name-description: Select your active environment. When you select an environment, the OTA Connect portal will reload and show the details for the selected environment.
profile.organization.nav.title: Settings environments
profile.organization.owner-tooltip: The owner of this  environment. They can't leave or be removed from it because it's their home environment.
profile.organization.remove-modal.desc: The member will no longer have access to the resources in this environment.
profile.organization.remove-modal.desc.s: This will revoke your access to its resources. To join again, a member of the environment will have to add you to it.
You are the only user of this environment. If you leave it, the environment will be permanently deleted.

software.blacklist_modal.bottom_text: On the Impact analysis tab, you can view which of your devices already have the blacklisted version of the package installed, letting you proactivly troubleshoot and update those devices to a fixed version, or roll them back to an older version.

software.blacklist_modal.top_text: With HERE OTA Connect, you can blacklist problem packages, ensuring they won’t get installed on any of your devices.

software.create-modal.description: Upload new software versions manually. Full-device images built with OTA Connect developer tools are uploaded automatically. You're responsible for the content of the software versions and their impact on devices. Please take care, make sure software is properly tested and that customer support is available.

updates.creating.description1: An update is a list of instructions that you can later use in a campaign. These instructions specify the control unit types and software versions that should be updated.
updates.creating.description2: Before you continue, make sure that you've provisioned some target devices and uploaded your new software versions.
updates.creating.wizard.information_step: Don't worry, it's OK to only have one control unit. This is normal.
Don't worry, you only have one piece of software in this list because you have only one control unit. Totally normal. No reason to panic.
updates.creating.wizard.no_sw_version_wa: If you select this option, you’ll be upgrading to the new version on all control units. Bear in mind that older software versions might not upgrade properly due to version incompatibility, and devices already updated will receive the same update.
updates.creating.wizard.select_ecu_types: If a device has multiple control units with the same type, all of these control units will get the update.

updates.empty.no-updates-2: Create software updates, and they will show up here.
